name: Birkenhead House & Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is literally the best place we have ever stayed in. I know this will read similar to the other reviews but they is not much more I can add.
reviews.title: Absolutley brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 1 in the Villa which had great views from our own terrace over the Atlantic. The room was simply exqusite. We stayed for 3 nights and only wish it could have been longer.
reviews.title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing was to much trouble for the staff. The food was great as was the wine. The staff booked us a whale trip and also quad biking together with a round of golf.
reviews.title: Great little hideaway

likes.liked: — lovely rooms and the stunning setting and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the spa and the treatments were great.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant

likes.liked: — The charming people, the attention to detail, the views, the food, the wine, the room, the bath, the spa, I could go on...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checkout all the staff came out to wish us a safe journey. Nice touch and will definatley go back soon.
reviews.title: Pampered and relaxed at Birkenhead House

likes.disliked: — Not walking distance to Hermanus centre, although there's a shuttle service

reviews.title: best of the best
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was breathtaking and fabulous. We could hear the sea pounding on the rocks at night, the views of the sea weremesmerizing!! The staff was very attentive to our every need. when there was a flood in our room on the first day due to a hot water heater leaking they moved us to another room while we off sightseing. The food was great, the wines were amazing. The whole experience was just great!

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: What an amzaing place, I cannot say enough good things about the Birkenhead. We stayed in the Birkenhead Villa in Hermanus which is just behing the house. There was only one other couple staying there when we were there, and it was just magical! On arrival we were given a cocktail each and sat down by the pool. Then we were served lunch by the in house chef, before being shown our room, which was absolutely amazing, and had a fantatic view over the water. The artwork in the villa is really beautiful, and the food is simply amazing! For dinner we just popped downstairs, which had been lit up with candles, and sat down in what felt like our own dining room with the other couple who were staying there. The staff are excellent and always doing little personal touches which make your stay so comfortable and relaxing.

reviews.title: Great Christmas
reviews.text: My husband was sick while we were there, and so asked the chef one night for just scrambled eggs on toast, and even they were done brilliantly - a measure of a great chef! Nothing was too much trouble for them and I would highly recommend this place.

reviews.title: Just Perfect
reviews.text: Birkenhead house is a luxury property situated about 30 minutes walk from the centre of Hermanus. Right above a great beach (sea chilly)

reviews.title: The Simply Divine Birkenhead House - home from home
reviews.text: Best bits: The rooms are stunning, large very stylish. Service great. Meals very good. Small but good gym. Internet if you need it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could see whales (hundreds of them!) from our bed... Very cool room and relaxed dining atmosphere -- it almost feels like a friend has invited you to a dinner party and has asked your opinion on what to serve. Totally relaxing.
reviews.title: Like staying at your own (very cool) glass villa by the sea....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Birkenhead House (next door) is more traditional -- a small boutique hotel -- You can use all the facilities but there is something much more intimate and unique (and modern) about Birkenhead Villa...
reviews.title: Stunning location - 100 percent luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb hotel in wonderful location with sounds of the surf all around. Very elegant. Food very good and ambience excellent. Wonderful spot for relaxing , walking on teh immaculate beaches and through the fynbos. Lacks a cocktail bar area but otherwsie pretty perfect.
reviews.title: Like staying a somebody's spectacular private home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Birkenhead House during our honeymoon in the summer of 2008...Most people suggested that we stay at the Marine in Hermanus but the Birkenhead House seemed more personal and private...We pulled into the Birkenhead House and were met by a few staff members...They escorted us into the hotel and showed us our room...The only problem we experienced during out stay was that they brought us to the wrong room...The room we were supposed to be in was being renovated and they didn't mentioned anything about the room switch until we brought it up to them...We asked to move to a different room (much smaller but with a different view) and they quickly got that room ready and refunded the difference...Not a huge deal but wish that they would have told us instead of me bringing it up to them...The hotel is basically a beautiful seaside house with great design, art and attention to detail...There are two pools (one in the back of the house the other in an open courtyard in the middle of the house) and the house sits on a cliff overlooking the ocean and surrounded by beautiful beaches...It was the winter so the swimming and sunbathing options were to a minimum but the place must be lovely in the summer...Our plan was to go whale watching but the sea was too rough...We just relaxed, took a nap and enjoyed the house...Dinner was very good and was personalized as much as possible...The chef came out to talk to us about anything special or different that we wanted...Hermanus is lovely and the area produces the best Pinot Noir in South Africa (Hamilton Hussell and Bouchard Finlayson) and the drive from Franschhoek was lovely...During our stay there was a pretty severe winter storm...Although it limited our use of the outdoor space but we got an understanding of how rough the weather could get in this part of the world...We were in out small room on the cliff's edge and we felt the full force of the storm and were happy we weren't on a boat...Except for the small mix-up with the room we couldn't recommend the Birkenhead House enough and is worth the extra money versus the other hotels in the area...Make sure you look at the website as each room is different...Some have better views, others are much bigger.
reviews.title: we will be going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at Birkenhead House and can't wait to go back. After a beautiful and easy drive from capetown we were greeted by the friendly staff, given a tour and a glass of champagne. The service is effortless and the fact that its all inclusive means you can relax and not worry about drink charges, tipping etc. Food was excellent and a great wine selection. The view from the terrace is breathtaking with great walks to the beach or back into town.
reviews.title: Best costal setting in SA!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rarely do I stay at a hotel I would go back to - but Birkenhead House is one place I definitely want to revisit. We stayed for 2 nights and only wish it could have been longer.
reviews.title: Chillaxed Bliss

likes.disliked: — Having to go full board every day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is amazing (on cliffs overlooking sea) and from there you get amazing sunsets and whales for breakfast lunch and dinner (even in Dec which is not officially in season).
reviews.title: Nearly Excellent

likes.disliked: — Felt the choice and quality of food did not measure up for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole decor and ambience of the hotel is excellent - yet there is still a very relaxed and chilled out atmosphere and lots of nice little touches such as free drinks and running a candlelit bath for you whilst you are at dinner.
reviews.title: Lovely luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the only negative point is around the dining in the evening - the house was full and so the dining room feels a little cramped and not very private. If I was staying for longer I think this could become annoying as you have to go full board.
reviews.title: Birkenhead house = A+

likes.liked: — High quality of service, food and hotel itself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall would definitely recommend this place!
reviews.title: Best Hotel!

description: Perched on the Hermanus cliffs, the regal Birkenhead House and deluxe adjacent Villa, overlook the whale watching paradise of Walker Bay. Accommodating guests in the utmost luxury, this is the perfect destination for those seeking the pinnacle of seaside living.
